p: Similarly, antimicrobial resistance (AMR) has been identified as a substantial threat to global health security with uncontrolled use of antibiotics, antivirals and antiparasitic treatments, rendering microbes increasingly resistant to existing medicines. 4 Humans, animals and the environment, in turn, are mutually affected by these health threats, highlighting the need to engage with complex socio-biological ecosystems. 5 6 As a consequence, emerging infectious diseases (EIDs) and AMR urgently require transformations in global public health governance. 7â€“9
